availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James E. Fagan (Henderson County, Kentucky, plasterer.)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, plasterer. Kentucky native. Married to Matilda J. Nesler Fagan in Henderson County, Kentucky, on December 9, 1851. Father of Sarah Bell Fagan and Clara Fagan. Married to Kate Fagan. Father of Charles Fagan and Mary Fagan. Plasterer in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Plasterer in Henderson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Henderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 1, p. 57B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 16.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 153A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson Ward 3, p. 131A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994038, Henderson County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film 001944390.
